triples.evidence: To minimize this risk, we use lead shielding, such as lead glass windows and lead aprons.

When we use X-rays on a patient, most of the useful photons travel through the body and reach the detector to form the image. But many photons do not follow this direct path - instead, they are scattered in different directions. These scattered photons, especially those from Compton scattering, can expose people nearby.
Compton scattering has major implications for radiation protection.
